description.plain:
Isaiah Rashad McClain (born May 16, 1991), is an American rapper and record producer from Chattanooga, Tennessee.

He began rapping seriously as a sophomore in high school with his friends.  In 2012 he got his first big break when he toured alongside the likes of  Juicy J, Joey Bada$$, and Smoke DZA on the Smoker’s Club Tour.

He also founded his hip-hop collective alongside fellow Chattanooga rapper YGTUT.  The two released Rashad’s first mixtape Welcome to the Game, also known as Pieces of a Kid, in 2013.  In March of the same year, Rashad signed to Top Dawg Entertainment.

In 2014, he released his first extended play Cilvia Demo with all star features from fellow TDE members including SZA, Jay Rock, and ScHoolboy Q.

After the release of Cilvia Demo, Rashad struggled with drug addiction and depression.  Although he had struggled previously as described throughout Cilvia Demo, his abuse and mental health issues became so bad he almost got dropped from TDE.

On September 2, 2016, he released his debut studio album, The Sun’s Tirade to critical acclaim. The album again featured guest appearances from TDE members including Zacari, Kendrick Lamar, SZA, as well as non-TDE-affiliate Mike WiLL Made-It as a producer.

In March of 2018, Rashad said he would drop an album in the coming summer, however he did not.  Then, in September, Rashad tweeted he would not update fans how his project was coming together, but confirmed he was continuing working on it.

https://twitter.com/isaiahrashad/status/1039746764260208640

body.plain:
Isaiah Rashad McClain (born May 16, 1991), is an American rapper and record producer from Chattanooga, Tennessee.

He began rapping seriously as a sophomore in high school with his friends.  In 2012 he got his first big break when he toured alongside the likes of  Juicy J, Joey Bada$$, and Smoke DZA on the Smoker’s Club Tour.

He also founded his hip-hop collective alongside fellow Chattanooga rapper YGTUT.  The two released Rashad’s first mixtape Welcome to the Game, also known as Pieces of a Kid, in 2013.  In March of the same year, Rashad signed to Top Dawg Entertainment.

In 2014, he released his first extended play Cilvia Demo with all star features from fellow TDE members including SZA, Jay Rock, and ScHoolboy Q.

After the release of Cilvia Demo, Rashad struggled with drug addiction and depression.  Although he had struggled previously as described throughout Cilvia Demo, his abuse and mental health issues became so bad he almost got dropped from TDE.

On September 2, 2016, he released his debut studio album, The Sun’s Tirade to critical acclaim. The album again featured guest appearances from TDE members including Zacari, Kendrick Lamar, SZA, as well as non-TDE-affiliate Mike WiLL Made-It as a producer.

In March of 2018, Rashad said he would drop an album in the coming summer, however he did not.  Then, in September, Rashad tweeted he would not update fans how his project was coming together, but confirmed he was continuing working on it.

songs.full_title: Wat's Wrong by Isaiah Rashad (Ft. Kendrick Lamar & Zacari)
songs.title: Wat’s Wrong

description.plain:
This track deals more explicitly with the substance abuse problem that almost saw him lose his deal with TDE and be dropped from the label. Rashad battles with his emotions, and Kendrick’s dazzling verse can be read as a direct conversation with Rashad, encouraging him to follow a righteous path, be that via religion or rap.

https://twitter.com/isaiahrashad/status/771400243061501952

[Hook: Zacari]
Oh sometimes I get so ahead of myself
Feel like I'm runnin' in circles
Oh and I'm just holdin' onto my breath

Okay, I'ma tell you this story, man...A few years ago, I gave my pops, uh, Cilvia, Cilvia Demo and my pops said, uh...he listened to it for about a week, came back to me, said, uh...said, "Dang, boy, why...Zay talkin' 'bout he gon' run up in somebody house? He...he...he talkin' 'bout you?"76Embed

songs.title: Heavenly Father

description.plain:
“Heavenly Father” is an introspective song detailing the everyday pressures, depressions and issues that come with having a conscious view on the world.

Many of the issues are connected to his lack of fatherly guidance. A double entendre, Isaiah is referring both to his biological father and spiritual father, God.

Depression is one of the many themes and issues addressed on this album, and Isaiah’s own problems related to this are what lead him to make the track in particular.

This track is also about Isaiah’s non-existent relationship with his father.  He expresses how the music industry would be much easier to navigate with a father figure to have his back.

songs.embed_content: Read “Heavenly Father” by Isaiah Rashad on Genius

songs.title: 4r da Squaw

description.plain:
“Squaw” is best interpreted as a southern way of writing and pronouncing “squad.” It can be thought of in the same vein as “clique”, “crew”, or “team.”  In this case, Isaiah has his friends from Tennessee in mind.

He also offers his gratitude towards the rap industry, and the blessings he’s received from pursuing and realising his talent. He’s able to pay his mom’s bills, even if his money management isn’t always great. He recognises his responsibilities as a son and a father are helped by sobriety.
